data.title: First time
data.text: My son is 4.5 and we went to try out the Museum being new in town. The different stations were noce, however when it is busy there isnt enough room or supplies for more than a vouple kids to play at a time. Older kids were just running everywhere! Not sure I would go back!!

data.title: Underwhelming
data.text:
The museum is not much of a museum, but rather more of a play place. The overall concept is not bad, but the lighting, decor, and quality of toys needs some upkeep. My son really enjoyed the HEB area and the rocket ship. The craft area was nice too, but the supplies were scattered and not well displayed. I wish there was more posters or educational information throughout the museum. 

If you are looking for something to do and have $5 per person to spare then I would say make the visit, but it's not worth the annual membership and don't expect anything special.

data.title: They LOVE This Museum!!
data.text: My grandchildren LOVE this place! They have been to this museum at least three times (only 5 and 3 years old) and they can spend over 3 hours in the place. My husband and I took turns as they enjoyed every activity (I had some other shopping and errands to do). They have plenty of toys at home, but something about digging in sand for "dinosaur bones" and playing grocery store is more fun at this museum. The large rocket ship as you first walk in is also amazing to this toddler set.

data.title: Dangerous for young kids
data.text: Visited during Christmas holidays with 2 & 5 year old grandsons.  There was a small group of kids (about 10 year olds) there who were yelling, rude, running from station to station with no supervision.  If I hadn't been close to my children, they could have been knocked down, and they were afraid to get far from me - not their usual behavior.  I asked the person at the desk for help.  She was not interested but made an announcement on a speaker that I couldn't even understand.  Cost about $18 and we left after about 20 minutes.  Our kids might have been interested otherwise.

data.title: Fun for the kids
data.text: The children's museum has grown a little and definitely improved the activities since moving to the new location on E. 29th St.  We are members and take our children a couple of times a month to play and explore.

data.title: worth it
data.text: this place is fantastic for my children.  they loved every inch of it and i cant wait to take them again

data.title: Greatly Lacking
data.text: There is a lot of blank, open space in the new location. The old staff which my kids loved have all left and the place seems to run more like a profit focused business rather than the non-profit that it is. A lot of the newer exhibits are broken and I wouldn't let my children play with them for safety reasons. The costumes, trains, puppets, library and chess/checkers set are no longer there. My kids were not very well entertained as we own a lot of similar items at home. The daily activities were not appropriate and the staff didn't seem well informed about them. When you enter they ask for your personal information such as ethnicity and zip code because they have to have it and you have to sign off on media release. This was all uncomfortable to me as I have never been asked this entering a museum. I also wanted to book my child's birthday here, but all the policies have changed and it's not the same quality. Overall, the $5/person admission price was not worth it.

data.title: Needs Improvements
data.text: Since the museum has moved, it has become lackluster. They have a lot of empty floor space now. If someone didn't gift us a membership, we would not purchase one because it isn't worth it.

data.title: Great Fun for Kids!!
data.text: When traveling to Bryan with toddler nephew we deliberately stay in downtown Bryan for the easy access to the entertainment of the museum. The fun includes: train tables, trucks and other toys, rocket ship, art station, news room area with costumes, construction zone, grocery checkout, health zone, library, kid size chess/checkers. Great fun!! For the children and even the adults chaperoning. We loved the rocket ship and traveling to Mars! If you love trains they have plenty of trains to play with plus a train track where real trains go by outside! You could stay here for a short while or a long while. Your admission counts for all-day even if you leave and come back!!
